metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14318 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way samba handled file and directory permissions. An authenticated user could use this flaw to gain access to certain file and directory information which otherwise would be unavailable to the attacker.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
libnss-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
libpam-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
libsmbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
libwbclient0 - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
python3-samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
registry-tools - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-common - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-common-bin - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-libs - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-testsuite - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
smbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.6').
